result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin G Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment plan of $50.00 per month to commence March 7, 2015 and monthly thereafter until paid in full.

Defendant Devin G Schultz in court with attorney Michael F Torphy.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea questionnaire filed.  
State's offer and recommendation:  Plea to count 1, dismiss/read-in count 2.  $100 + cc
Court colloquy re rights being waived, elements of crime and possible penalty.
Defendant stipulates to understanding
State consents to jury waiver
PLEA - guilty
Finding and judgment of guilt.  Court finds plea entered freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently.
Sentencing argument.
Statement by defendant.
BTC: $300 + cc, FTP 30 days.  60 days to pay.  DNA surcharge.
PPP $50 per month commencing March 7 and monthly thereafter until paid in full

Preliminary hearing on October 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Do not drive unless properly licensed.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
